name: Remy Russell
summary: An optimistic tech enthusiast with 10 years of experience advancing SaaS platforms for Health and Human Services providers. Committed to a collaborative software development process, leveraging the best tools and tactics for productivity, transparency, and impactful outcomes.

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Platform and Integrations R&D team/pod for a configurable Case Management platform used by over 160 customers (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health)
highlights: Enabled ~50% growth in ARR over 3 years by expanding platform interoperability and team capabilities
Shipped a RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded developers for 10 customer organizations to enable custom integrations (https://apidoc.eccovia.com)
Optimized delivery operations for 6 organizations with a strategic integration micrroservice, enabling thousands of daily meal deliveries
Aligned stakeholders and delivered features based on business priorities and insights (SSO & 2-Step Verification, SMS/email automations via Twilio, scheduled CSV exports, etc)
Led initiatives for standardized clinical data integrations (HL7, X12) so that users could access clinical history, perform Medicaid eligibility Checks, and export claims

professionalExperience.description: Problem discovery, requirements gathering, and solution delivery leveraging the case management platform
highlights: Drove successful implementation for 2 of Eccovia's top 10 largest customers by ARR, with complex data migration, system design, and reporting needs
Delivered over a dozen integration contracts and helped transition technical strategy towards agnostic services supporting multiple customers/partners

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, UT MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: System migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a Medicaid Management Information System for the Utah Department of Health
highlights: Collaborated with customer and internal teams to iterate detailed system design documents and guide development/testing of the Provider Enrollment Subsystem

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst, MI MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Analyzed program mandates published by CMS and iterated the 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution used by providers to report 'Meaningful Use' of EHRs

coreSkills: Problem discovery, learning from users and buyers
Stakeholder communication and ability to articulate technical details or high-level strategy based on audience
Managing priorities & decisions with objective data and subjective variables
Facilitating collaboration, hypothesis testing, and rapid/iterative delivery
Defining user journeys, epics, stories, acceptance criteria, etc. for efficient solution delivery
toolsAndFrameworks: Agile, Scrum (Jira for roadmapping, backlog refinement, Kanban boards, sprint ceremonies, KPI dashboards)
API evaluation/testing, workflow automation (Postman, Zapier, Microsoft Power Automate)
